title: Cremona group
summary: In algebraic geometry, the Cremona group, introduced by CremonaÂ (1863, 1865), is the group of birational automorphisms of the n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional projective space over a field k {\displaystyle k} . It is denoted by C r ( P n ( k ) ) {\displaystyle Cr(\mathbb {P} ^{n}(k))} or B i r ( P n ( k ) ) {\displaystyle Bir(\mathbb {P} ^{n}(k))} or C r n ( k ) {\displaystyle Cr_{n}(k)} .
